publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1234 Pauline McNeill: Children's and Maternal Services at Yorkhill-That the Parliament notes Greater Glasgow Health Board's decision to continue examination of the planning issues concerning future major investment in children's services, further notes the clinical and structural case for retention of the child and maternal services at their existing site at Yorkhill, and urges the Health Board to invest in developing the existing buildings in order to ensure that the Royal Hospital for Sick Children at Yorkhill retains its unique services at the current site for the next 30 to 40 years.
S1M-1234 Children's and Maternal Services at Yorkhill (lodged on 3 October 2000) Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-1234 Children's and Maternal Services at Yorkhill (lodged on 3 October 2000) Robert Brown*, Mr Jamie Stone*

S1M-1234 Pauline McNeill: Children's and Maternal Services at Yorkhill—That the Parliament notes Greater Glasgow Health Board’s decision to continue examination of the planning issues concerning future major investment in children’s services, further notes the clinical and structural case for retention of the child and maternal services at their existing site at Yorkhill, and urges the Health Board to invest in developing the existing buildings in order to ensure that the Royal Hospital for Sick Children at Yorkhill retains its unique services at the current site for the next 30 to 40 years. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Robert Brown, Mr Jamie Stone
S1M-1234 Children's and Maternal Services at Yorkhill (lodged on 3 October 2000) Andrew Wilson*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Ms Sandra White*, Michael Russell*

S1M-1234 Pauline McNeill: Children's and Maternal Services at Yorkhill—That the Parliament notes Greater Glasgow Health Board’s decision to continue examination of the planning issues concerning future major investment in children’s services, further notes the clinical and structural case for retention of the child and maternal services at their existing site at Yorkhill, and urges the Health Board to invest in developing the existing buildings in order to ensure that the Royal Hospital for Sick Children at Yorkhill retains its unique services at the current site for the next 30 to 40 years. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Robert Brown, Mr Jamie Stone, Andrew Wilson, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Ms Sandra White, Michael Russell
S1M-1234 Children's and Maternal Services at Yorkhill (lodged on 3 October 2000) Elaine Smith*

S1M-1234 Pauline McNeill: Children's and Maternal Services at Yorkhill—That the Parliament notes Greater Glasgow Health Board’s decision to continue examination of the planning issues concerning future major investment in children’s services, further notes the clinical and structural case for retention of the child and maternal services at their existing site at Yorkhill, and urges the Health Board to invest in developing the existing buildings in order to ensure that the Royal Hospital for Sick Children at Yorkhill retains its unique services at the current site for the next 30 to 40 years. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Robert Brown, Mr Jamie Stone, Andrew Wilson, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Ms Sandra White, Michael Russell, Elaine Smith
S1M-1234 Children's and Maternal Services at Yorkhill (lodged on 3 October 2000) Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-1234 Pauline McNeill: Children's and Maternal Services at Yorkhill—That the Parliament notes Greater Glasgow Health Board’s decision to continue examination of the planning issues concerning future major investment in children’s services, further notes the clinical and structural case for retention of the child and maternal services at their existing site at Yorkhill, and urges the Health Board to invest in developing the existing buildings in order to ensure that the Royal Hospital for Sick Children at Yorkhill retains its unique services at the current site for the next 30 to 40 years. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Robert Brown, Mr Jamie Stone, Andrew Wilson, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Ms Sandra White, Michael Russell, Elaine Smith, Tommy Sheridan
